security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and commit message templates. No executable code, no file system access beyond its own assets, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. The skill provides workflow guidance for writing conventional commits.

content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages is hard. This skill provides templates, conventions, and workflows for creating meaningful commit messages that improve code review and project maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Follow Conventional Commits format with type prefixes
Create atomic commits with one logical change per commit
Format commit messages within character limits
Write imperative subject lines and detailed body text
Reference issues and breaking changes in footers
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Does not perform force pushes or rebases
Requires explicit user confirmation before commits

use_cases.title: Standardize team commits
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent commit message format across team repositories

use_cases.title: Follow project conventions
use_cases.description: Create pull requests with professional commit messages

use_cases.title: Automate changelog generation
use_cases.description: Generate readable changelogs from structured commit history

prompt_templates.title: Simple commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a commit message for these staged changes that fixes a bug in the user authentication module.

prompt_templates.title: Feature commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a conventional commit message for adding dark mode support. Include the scope 'theme' and explain the breaking change in the footer.

prompt_templates.title: Complex changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my staged changes across multiple files. Create separate atomic commits with clear messages following conventional commit format.

prompt_templates.title: Release preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate appropriate commit messages for a release that includes new features, bug fixes, and documentation updates. Group them appropriately.

output_examples.input: Help me commit my staged changes that add user profile picture upload feature
output: feat(user-profile): add profile picture upload capability
Implement user profile picture upload with validation, storage optimization, and accessibility support.
BREAKING CHANGE: Profile API now requires additional 'avatar' field

best_practices: Explain the 'why' behind changes in the body
Use imperative mood for all commit messages
anti_patterns: Writing vague messages like 'fixed bug' or 'updated code'
Including multiple unrelated changes in single commits
Neglecting to reference related issues or pull requests

faq.question: What tools support conventional commits?
faq.answer: Most git tools and CI systems support it. Claude, Codex, and Claude Code can generate compliant messages using this skill.

faq.question: What is the character limit for commit messages?
faq.answer: Keep subject lines under 50 characters and wrap body text at 72 characters for optimal readability.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my git workflow?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance. You still run git commands yourself. It lists safe commands like git add and git commit.

faq.question: Is my commit data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides templates and guidance. No data leaves your machine. No external calls are made.

faq.question: What if my project does not use conventional commits?
faq.answer: You can still use the templates. The skill focuses on clarity and consistency, which benefits any commit style.

faq.question: How is this different from other commit tools?
faq.answer: This is a pure guidance skill with no code execution. It works with any git client and AI assistant.
